intro: Melopepo, commonly known as the "Mexican nightshade," is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with branching stems and ovate, hairy leaves. Its fruit, a small, egg-shaped berry, turns from green to yellow or red when mature. Melopepo is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
